intro: Diporidium delagoense, commonly known as the Delagoense thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It features spiny leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
